alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 6:15PM MDT until September 30 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTY... At 615 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over Sulphur Creek. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of dry washes, creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sulphur Creek and the Grand Wash in Capitol Reef National Park, and Fruita. This includes the following streams and drainages... Fremont River and Sulphur Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
